snippet: Conservative critics, joined by their Republican allies on Capitol Hill, are trying to make the case that President Obama has overstepped his authority.
abstract: Conservative critics, joined by their Republican allies on Capitol Hill, are trying to make the case that Pres Obama has overstepped his authority in applying his health care law; fresh wave of legal challenges to Affordable Care Act that began with Supreme Court challenge to law is playing out in courtrooms and shows no signs of abating.

byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from South Bend, Ind.

lead_paragraph: Conservative critics, joined by their Republican allies on Capitol Hill, are trying to make the case that President Obama has overstepped his authority.

headline.main: A New Wave of Challenges to Health Law
headline.print_headline: A New Wave Of Challenges To Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
